Complete dates for all group combinations

Source: R/complete_dates.R
complete_dates.Rd

This function ensures that an incidence object has the same range of dates for each grouping. By default missing counts will be filled with 0L.

Usage

complete_dates(x, expand = TRUE, fill = 0L, by = 1L)

Arguments

x

<incidence2> object.

expand

[logical]

Should a range of dates from the minimum to maximum value of the date index also be created.

fill

[numeric]

The value to replace missing counts by. Defaults to 0L.

by

Passed as the by argument to seq.

If expand is TRUE (default) then complete_dates will attempt to use function(x) seq(min(x), max(x), by = by) to generate a complete sequence of dates.

Defaults to 1L.

Value

An <incidence2> object.

Examples

x <- data.frame(
    dates = Sys.Date() + c(1,3,4),
    groups = c("grp1","grp2", "grp1"),
    counts = 1:3
)

i <- incidence(x, date_index = "dates", groups = "groups", counts = "counts")
complete_dates(i)
#> # incidence:  8 x 4
#> # count vars: counts
#> # groups:     groups
#>   date_index groups count_variable count
#>   <date>     <chr>  <fct>          <int>
#> 1 2023-03-18 grp1   counts             1
#> 2 2023-03-18 grp2   counts             0
#> 3 2023-03-19 grp1   counts             0
#> 4 2023-03-19 grp2   counts             0
#> 5 2023-03-20 grp1   counts             0
#> 6 2023-03-20 grp2   counts             2
#> 7 2023-03-21 grp1   counts             3
#> 8 2023-03-21 grp2   counts             0
